Title: 18-044 Fire and Security Systems, Service, Repair and Maintenance
Description:
Rotherham Borough Council is looking for a suitably experienced contractor to provide a range of services, including but not limited to:

•	Fire and Intruder Alarms -maintenance, with occasional elements of new or replacement supply and installation
•	Emergency Lighting - maintenance, with occasional elements of new or replacement supply and installation
•	Monitoring Services - alarm activations
•	Access Control - maintenance, with occasional elements of new or replacement supply and installation
•	CCTV (Excluding Highways) - maintenance and monitoring, with occasional elements of new or replacement supply and installation.
The core element of the contract is the provision of maintenance services.

Title: Periodic 5 Yearly Electrical Testing
Description: The tender documents are available for interested suppliers to download from the YORtender system (www.yortender.co.uk) using reference A7EJ-QWU598. Bidders are required to register on this site in order to access the documentation. Registration is free. For assistance with registering on the YORtender site and/or accessing the documents please contact +44 1670597136 or email yorkshiresupport@due-north.com. The Council require a suitably qualified contractor to undertake 100% (all circuits) Electrical condition, testing and inspection of electrical installations within the Council buildings listed on the attached Appendix A. The inspections must verify that the Electrical installation is in a safe condition and complies with the requirements of the current edition of the BS 7671 IEE wiring regulations and Electricity at work regulations (1989). The inspections cover the 5 year period of 1st January 2016 to 31st December 2020 programme. Please ensure that all the requirements, as detailed within the attached documentation, are fully met.

Title: Building Services Framework
Description:
Sunderland City Council is seeking expressions of interest from contractors wishing to be considered for a Building Services Framework. The Framework will cover a range of building service works spread over 40 lots and will replace and supplement an existing framework which is due to expire shortly.

This is an electronic tender via the Council's ProContract eTender system. All organisations interested in this tender should register an expression of interest against this contract online at 'www.nepoportal.org', Tender Reference DN290910. The Council will be using the OJEU Open Procurement Procedure and submissions must be returned by 12 noon on 29th September 2017, in accordance with the instructions in the documents. All tender documents are available via the portal.

As part of the tender process Sunderland City Council intend to hold tender clarification briefings on 5th September 2017 at Sunderland Civic Centre, full details including how to register are contained in the tender pack. The aim of the briefing is to provide advice on submitting a compliant tender. Attendance at this briefing is not a mandatory part of the tender process but is recommended.

Title: Hard Facilities Management 2020-2024
Description:
The Authority wishes to establish a new framework arrangement to support the delivery of its Hard Facilities Management (FM) services, including responsive maintenance and the statutory inspection and testing of building services. The resulting framework will be titled Hard FM 2020-2024.
The framework includes the provision of cyclical inspection and servicing and responsive repairs, including emergency call outs for some lots. The tender is divided into the following 12 lot activities each of which is further split into two geographical areas of east and west (based approximately down the A1 /A1(M) corridor) of the County of North Yorkshire creating a total of 24 lots:

LOT 1E & 1W:	General Building: Responsive Maintenance
LOT 2E & 2W:	Mechanical Equipment and Plant: Servicing and Responsive Maintenance
LOT 3E & 3W:	Alarms (Fire and Intruder): Servicing and Responsive Maintenance
LOT 4E & 4W: Lifts: Servicing and Responsive Maintenance
LOT 5E & 5W:	Automatic Doors: Inspection and Responsive Maintenance
LOT 6E & 6W:	Fixed Electrical Inspection and Testing and Portable Appliance Testing
LOT 7E & 7W:	Chimneys, Lightning Conductors and other High Access Structures: Inspection and Maintenance
LOT 8E & 8W:	Water Hygiene: Risk Assessment and Monitoring
LOT 9E & 9W:	Fire Equipment: Inspection and Supply
LOT 10E & 10W: PE and External Play Equipment: Inspection and Minor Repair
LOT 11E & 11W: Asbestos Analysis
LOT 12E & 12W: Asbestos Abatement

Title: Gas Equipment Maintenance and Repair Services
Description: The NWUPC is seeking to establish a multi-provider Framework Agreement on behalf of the members of NWUPC, CPC, APUC, HEPCW, LUPC, SUPC and NEUPC for gas equipment maintenance and repairs. Members referred to in the OJEU Notice may also participate in the Framework Agreement. This Framework Agreement will commence on 1.8.2019 for an initial period of 24 months until 31.7.2021 with the option to extend the Agreement for 12 months until 31.7.2022 and a further 12 months until 31.7.2023 subject to satisfactory economic operator performance. The Framework Agreement will be split into 28 lots covering 14 regions for domestic and non-domestic equipment up to 500 kw rated input and 14 regions for non-domestic equipment greater than 500 kw rated input.

Title: Servicing, Maintenance and Repair of Non-Domestic Gas Systems
Description:
THIS IS A CONTRACT AWARD NOTICE

Hanover is awarding contracts for the provision of Non-Domestic Gas Heating Systems to deliver the twice yearly servicing maintenance and repair of non-domestic gas-fired heating and hot water systems, incorporating the annual LGSR check and reactive maintenance of gas fired communal heating and hot water systems, indirect unvented cylinders, control equipment, pipework and radiators, heat interface units, heat recovery units and CHP servicing. 

Hanover is appointing three contractors across 4 regional lots to service and maintain the communal gas heating and gas hot water systems across the portfolio of 107 estates nationally. 

The contract term is for 5 years plus 2 plus 2 years, with a break clause 3 years into the contract. The term is subject to assessment of value for money and performance against specific Key Performance Indicators (KPI) targets. The extension may be let to the full extension period or part thereof.
Region: North East,North West,Yorkshire and the Humber,East Midlands,West Midlands,East of England,London,South East,South West,Channel Islands

Organisation Name: Cheshire Constabulary on behalf of the Police and Crime Commissioner for Cheshire
Title: Electrical Maintenance, Servicing ,Repairs and Small Works Services
Description:
This is a Contract Award Notice.
The Police and Crime Commissioner for Cheshire (PCC) is inviting successful contractors on a Lot basis to provide Electrical related services at both the PCC's and Cheshire Fire Authority (CFA's) premises.  (This excludes the Force Headquarters at Winsford, as this is subject to Facilities Management under a PFI Contract).  Contractors will be required to provide cyclical servicing, maintenance work, minor works, repairs which could be on a routine or call-out basis and ad-hoc new work.  The ad-hoc new work jobs within lots 1/2/3) will not exceed £25k value per job, Lot 4 will cover electrical project works between £10k-£100k and be subject to competitive quotes.  Any ad-hoc new work/jobs will be called off as and when required.  Contractors will be required to provide a 24/7/365(366) service and offer a reactive maintenance and repair service within 3 hours for all emergency work.  

Lot 1 - Area A (Western) - Planned and reactive maintenance including PA Testing, out of hours cover and ad-hoc new work
Lot 2 - Area B (Northern) - Planned and reactive maintenance including PA Testing, out of hours cover and ad-hoc new work
Lot 3 - Area C (Eastern) - Planned and reactive maintenance including PA Testing, out of hours cover and ad-hoc new work
